https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/488.name: IBM Call for Code University Edition
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/488.description:
Now in its third year, the Call for Code Global Challenge is a multi-year global initiative that rallies developers, visionaries, and problem solvers to create practical, effective, and high-quality applications based on cloud, data, and artificial intelligence that can have an immediate and lasting impact on humanitarian issues. Call for Code brings start-up, academic, community, and enterprise developers together and inspires them to solve the most pressing societal issues of our time.

This year’s Call for Code Challenge has been expanded to two tracks in order to tackle two life-altering world problems: COVID-19 and climate change. These issues have the power to compromise our health, our planet and our survival - and need to be addressed now. More information about this year’s challenge can be found on the Challenge homepage: https://callforcode.org/

Additionally, in partnership with the Clinton Global Initiative University (CGI U), we are launching the inaugural University Edition of the 2020 Call for Code Global Challenge. This will activate student developers, like you, to tackle these world problems. Through a series of virtual hackathons, workshops and other learning opportunities, you will be enabled with the skills necessary to work as a team and create solutions to these issues.

The 2020 Call for Code Global Challenge - University Edition will kick-off on Earth Day, April 22, with a virtual introduction by IBM’s Chief Developer Advocate and GM Willie Tejada and a special guest speaker to be revealed soon! Following the session, which will include a Q&A, our developer advocates will host workshops to get you started on your projects.

Stay tuned in the Slack Workspace (add the #University channel) for information on upcoming virtual hackathons, enablement sessions, office hours and more!

We will be supporting you every step of the way. From helping you construct a team, to ideation sessions. From roadblocks in your project, to how to present what you’ve created. For any problem you run into, there will be an IBMer excited to work through it with you.

You are the future, and we hope you will join us by answering the call to make a brighter tomorrow for our planet. There has never been a more important time than right now to use technology for good.


Here are some helpful links to get you started!
April 22 Event Registration link:
https://cgiu.cgiforms.org/view.php?id=141342

Helpful COVID Code Patterns
https://github.ibm.com/spackows/AI-ContentOps/tree/master/COVID-19

Slack info
www.callforcode.org/slack - Please add the #University channel

COVID Starter Kits:

https://github.com/Call-for-Code/Solution-Starter-Kit-Communication-2020
https://github.com/Call-for-Code/Solution-Starter-Kit-Education-2020

Participants can work independently or in teams of up to 4 to develop efficient business solutions using data science, and the top 20 teams will share a $25,000 prize!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/505.name: Yelping From Home: The Tech Talk Series
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/505.location: Any Handshake student with a link to this event can view and RSVP
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/505.description:
***RSVP via Eventbrite (https://bit.ly/2LOQtdw)***

Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses, and one of the teams working behind the scenes to make that happen is our five star engineering and product teams.

Playing an active role in our community is a value that we have strongly prioritized over the years. Typically we would invite you to come to Yelp’s HQ to network, grab a slice of ‘za, and learn about the technology and culture behind Yelp. With stay-at-home orders across the globe, Yelp (like many of you) has had no choice but to adapt to these changes. We understand that this is a strange and challenging time for many, so we’d like to invite you to join us as we navigate this new normal for the tech community together. 

To stay connected, create space for folks to collaborate and share some of the things Yelp has been working on, we are launching our very own virtual tech talk series. This series of talks will feature Yelpers from engineering and product and will focus on themes such as career development, technical skills, workplace challenges and Yelp’s response to COVID-19.

Join us to hear "Code Review Etiquette" by Surashree Kulkarni and "5 Things We Wish We Knew When We Started Working as SWEs" by Banafsheh Derayat and Vanessa Gutierrez.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/490.name: Virtual HireUp Career Fair Hosted by the Pittsburgh Technology Council
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/490.description:
Hire Up Virtual Career Fair
What is the Hire UP Virtual Career Fair?
The Hire UP Virtual Career Fair provides an opportunity for employers and job seekers to connect and network online. For employers seeking to expand their pipeline of tech talent, the Hire UP event is and time efficient solution to recruitment efforts.  

Our hope is to connect displaced and underemployed regional workers with local companies who are hiring technical/corporate employees. For companies who are not hiring and/or have had layoffs, this could serve as outplacement support for displaced workers. 

WHEN: May 27, 2020 | 11 am to 3 pm
WHERE: Anywhere with an internet connection

What type of candidate is invited?
The main purpose of the event is for employers to recruit technical talent. Non-technical talent may attend, and employers may post non-technical jobs, however the focus is on tech roles. 
• Candidates seeking Full-time, Part-time, and Internships
• Recruit graduate and undergraduate talent

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/489.name: 2020 FUTURE NOW Media & Entertainment Conference
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/489.description:
APPLY NOW: http://www.futurenowconference.com/the-conference

FUTURE NOW Media & Entertainment Conference is the first conference of its kind, bringing unprecedented access and opportunity for leaders on the forefront of the industry and top college and graduate students to connect, learn, and grow together!

The industry’s most influential leaders, senior executives and professionals share insights about the broadcast, cable and digital media businesses along with the latest trends and emerging technologies. Through keynotes, panel discussions, workshops and intimate mentoring sessions, media professionals share about how to succeed in the industry and the range of possible job opportunities.

This is a rare and incredible learning and networking opportunity for students to make meaningful connections that will better prepare and position them to pursue their careers upon graduation.

The application materials of those accepted to attend the conference are included in a TALENT RESOURCE PORTFOLIO that FUTURE NOW provides to sponsors and executives in attendance as a resource to help fill internship and job openings. This is not a guarantee for a job, but it is a great opportunity for students to get noticed by companies present at the conference and not get lost in an online abyss!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/428.name: Learn2Lead - Crowe Summer Leadership Program
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/428.description:
Firm Overview
Visit Crowecareers.com and find out what it's like to work at one of the “50 Best Workplaces for New College Graduates.” Crowe ranked seventh on this 2016 Fortune list and was highly rated in survey feedback.
Crowe LLP (www.crowe.com) is one of the largest public accounting, consulting and technology firms in the United States. Crowe uses its deep industry expertise to provide audit services to public and private entities while also helping clients reach their goals with tax, advisory, risk and performance services. Crowe is recognized by many organizations as one of the country's best places to work. Crowe serves clients worldwide as an independent member of Crowe Global, one of the largest global accounting networks in the world. The network consists of more than 200 independent accounting and advisory services firms in more than 130 countries around the world.
Crowe Seeks Leaders | Summer Leadership Program, Learn2Lead (L2L)
Are you currently considering career options in public accounting, consulting, or technology? Would you like to enhance your leadership & team work skills while enriching your career knowledge & possibly finding a future internship? Do you like meeting & networking with professionals & fellow students from top universities/colleges in the US? Are you interested in what a national top public accounting, consulting, & technology firm can offer you? 
L2L is designed to provide leading students from select universities and colleges, the opportunity to learn more about Crowe’s core values, energizing culture, and our client services. While having fun and developing yourself professionally, programming may include team building exercises, leadership presentations, and/or professional business skill workshops. These activities are aimed at educating you on the leadership qualities needed to excel in the consulting arena.
Internship Opportunities Following the L2L Program
Attend L2L and you will also be considered for future opportunities with Crowe including 2021 internships. You will have the opportunity to work with clients to help determine their business needs, along with assisting companies in defining, designing, developing, and implementing business and technology solutions that provide critical value to their organization. 
L2L Key Requirements

•	Seeking a degree in one of the following preferred majors or similar background: 
o	Accounting
-      Computer Science / Computer Engineering (or related major)
o	Information Systems (or related major)
o	Informatics (or related major)
o	Supply Chain Mgmt., Operations (or related major)
o	Finance, Business Administration, Economics (or related major)

•	Minimum GPA of 3.2 required.  Minimum GPA of 3.4 preferred. 
•	Current Freshman, Sophomore or Junior 
•	Permanent resident and/or U.S. Citizen.

To register for this event please visit: https://app.brazenconnect.com/a/cmu_career/e/48R1M
The CMU Alumni Virtual Career Fair occurs on May 28 from 1:00pm - 3:00pm EDT.  Please note the following reminders and instructions for the event. We will be using the platform Brazen for the virtual fair. https://app.brazenconnect.com/a/cmu_career/e/48R1M
1) Before the event starts, log-in to Brazen to update your registration page if you haven’t already (top-right corner under your name). This registration page will allow you to add a resume and other key information for employers to view. To participate, you can log in with the same link to begin. https://app.brazenconnect.com/a/cmu_career/e/48R1M
2) Chats with employers have been set to 12 minutes. This time goes quickly, so I recommend brainstorming a few main takeaways that you would hope to capture/share before the time expires (i.e., contact information, job titles, next-step instructions, etc.) These are text-based chats – not video chats.
4) Click hereand scroll down to watch a video on what to expect.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/503.name: Annapurna Partners(Real estate private equity)- Virtual Info Session with Principal Michael Mogull
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/503.description:
You will Learn:

-How Mr. Mogull initially got into the real estate business and his background in the space over the last two decades.
-What Mr. Mogull's role is as Managing Principal of a real estate PE firm.
-What makes Annapurna different in their approach to the real estate private equity space.
-How to leverage the mentorship offered through our internship academy to compress time frames for career growth as a business leader and real estate professional.
-You will learn about the various employment opportunities available within our rapidly growing team. Current job opportunities include Acquisitions (Business Development) roles and Annapurna Academy, a 24-month internship/apprenticeship training program.
-What intrinsic character traits Annapurna looks for when he is recruiting future leaders for the firm.
-The pros and cons of working for a larger company versus a smaller company at the beginning of your career, and what Mr. Mogull wishes he did differently himself.
-Why the covid 19 pandemic is not something we see as a long term impediment to our growth.



About US:
Annapurna Partners is a private real estate investment, development and management firm. We identify commercial real estate opportunities by taking an entrepreneurial approach to create stakeholder value. Our strategies are opportunistic, focusing on building value and mitigating risk, while leveraging relationships with our large network of strategic sponsors and advisors throughout the United States. This team identifies, analyzes, develops, and operates investments from start to finish. Based in Fort Lauderdale, Annapurna Partners employs a strong team of corporate, financial, and operational and construction professionals.

To learn more please visit www.annapurnapartners.com

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/503.name: NNSA Graduate Fellowship Program Virtual Information Session June 2, 2020
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/503.description:
Register in advance for this webinar:
https://pnnl.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_4Sehe2IYSqqNilUOa18iAg 

Fellowships Available: Protect our nation’s security as a Department of Energy NNSA Graduate Fellow. NGFP is seeking highly motivated graduate-level students to grow as the next generation of national security leaders. The one-year, salaried (with benefits) fellowships offer:
• Hands-on experience in national security and nonproliferation;
• Career development, professional networking, and specialized training events; and
• Extensive interaction and collaboration with leading national security technology and policy experts.

These positions are open to students actively pursuing their master’s or doctoral degree as well as students who have achieved their graduate degree within the past 18 months. Details about the program can be found on at https://www.pnnl.gov/projects/ngfp The current application deadline is October 2, 2020 for positions that will begin in June 2021.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/503.name: PDT Partners | Demystifying Tech Careers in Quantitative Finance
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/503.description:
Thinking about a career in tech, but never considered a path in quantitative finance?  

During our 1-hour Zoom webinar, a panel of current PDT Partners technologists will talk about their career paths that led them to our firm, projects they’re currently working on, and commonly asked questions they've received from people outside the quantitative finance industry. We’ll also be giving a brief overview of the different groups within our technology organization. 

A career in quant finance shouldn’t feel out of reach. Our engineers come from a wide variety of backgrounds, ranging from startups and big tech, to well-known financial institutions.  We’re always looking for growth-minded individuals from any industry who love digging into data-driven problems. 

We’ll have the chat open during the webinar for you to ask our panelists questions, but we kindly ask you to submit questions when you register about specific topics you’re curious about.  

Speakers:
Rob Morse - Head of Data Strategy and Sourcing
Islay Symonette - Software Engineer
Dhrupad Bhardwaj - Software Engineer
Andy Lei - Software Engineer
Jingyuan Wang - Intern 2019, incoming Software Engineer 2020

Please register using the Non-Handshake Registration URL to receive the Zoom link.

We look forward to seeing you virtually on June 17th. Please feel free to invite friends!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/509.name: Virtual Session:  Office of the Secretary of Defense now hiring analysts
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/509.description:
Nat Horner (CMU EPP PhD '16) will describe hiring opportunities for analysts in Cost Assessment and Program Evaluation (CAPE) in the Office of the Secretary of Defense.

CAPE traces its lineage to Secretary McNamara's "Whiz Kids" -- an effort to bring objective, quantitative analysis to Pentagon decision making. The office is part think tank, part consulting firm, and part investigative agency, with the mission of providing its sole client—the Secretary of Defense—with timely, insightful, and unbiased analysis to aid strategic decisions. CAPE analysts have impact: our work informs decision makers at the highest levels of the Department and directly affects a $700B budget.

Requirements: Graduate education in quantitative fields; demonstrated analytical ability; a desire to make sense of the strategic picture; curiosity to learn about new topics; and an ability to lead cross-organizational teams.

Benefits: Exposure to the highest levels of the Department; the ability to see direct outcomes from your analysis; a cadre of smart, dedicated colleagues; the opportunity to network across DoD; streamlined hiring and promotion.

Nat has experience in other government agencies, think tanks, and research centers. He thinks CAPE is an awesome place to work, but is also happy to answer general questions about government and government-adjacent employment, as well as available fellowship programs. Stop by and say hi!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/507.name: A Day in the Life of a MATR Software Engineer!
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/507.description:
Moody's is an essential component of the global capital markets, providing credit ratings, research, tools and analysis that contribute to transparent and integrated financial markets. Moody's Corporation is the parent company of Moody's Investors Service, which provides credit ratings and research covering debt instruments and securities, and Moody's Analytics, which offers leading-edge software, advisory services and research for credit and economic analysis and financial risk management.

Are you interested in joining a community of developers at the intersection of finance and technology? Do you seek to collaborate with others to build risk analytics products and solutions that make an impact around the world using current and emerging technologies? If so, then the Moody’s Analytics Technology Rotation (MATR) program is for you! Join this event to learn more about this 2-year program that offers recent graduates the experiential benefits of job-hopping among start-ups with the stability and financial backing of a well-established company. As you rotate offices in the US, your curiosity will be met with a variety of challenging projects while receiving ongoing training and mentoring.

Join us on Zoom on June 11 at 1:00pm EST / 10:00am PST to learn about the MATR program from Moody’s representatives including recent grads who are current participants in the program. If interested in attending, please register for the event via Handshake!

For more details about the MATR program – go to our website at https://careers.moodys.com/students-and-graduates/moodys-analytics-technology-rotation-program/.

Bio on the Presenter
Bill Gaussa is currently the Head of Advanced Innovation at Philips.   As the Head of Advanced Innovation, Bill leads a diverse team of researchers, engineers, and marketers to transform new ideas into new ventures that delight our customers.    Immediately prior to that, Bill served in multiple leadership roles within Philips including leading Strategic Marketing, Advance Research, Clinical and Global Product Management.
Bill has experience across multiple industries with positions at McKesson (healthcare automation), Timesys (embedded software development), Inrange Technologies (IT), and Westinghouse (control systems).  Throughout his career, Bill has built upon his skills in Product Management, Healthcare Information Technology, Innovation Management, and Engineering to redefine how corporations can innovate in like agile startups.
Bill holds a Masters in Business Administration from Carnegie Mellon University and a Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical and Electronics Engineering from the University of Pittsburgh.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/514.description:
Our focus on equality and human rights have always been part of who we are. In 1975, AT&T became one of the first major American corporations to adopt a policy prohibiting discrimination against employees based on sexual orientation. This #PRIDE month, we reflect on how far we've come, but remain focused on the goals of true equality that still lie ahead.

This month we are proud to host a panel discussion with some of AT&T’s amazing employees regarding their experiences and involvement in the LGBTQ+ community. At the conclusion of the panel discussion we will have a live Q&A so be sure to bring your questions!

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/514.name: Wealth Management Banking Specialist Virtual Career Event
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/514.description:
Please join us on Wednesday, July 1st at 7:00p.m. Eastern Time, for our Wealth Management Banking Specialist Virtual Career Event.

Are you interested in launching a career with Bank of America/Merrill Lynch? Do you want to be at the forefront of the future of banking, with the ability to make financial lives better and the power to make a difference?

If so, we invite you to join us for this interactive event to hear firsthand from some of our leaders and top talent, and learn how you can build a successful career within Wealth Management Banking.

Wealth Management Banking Specialists partner with our Merrill Financial Advisors to provide banking solutions to individual wealth management clients with assets generally in the range of $1-10 million.  This includes providing consistent, thorough and transparent experiences that give clients knowledge of banking, digital and credit solutions. Wealth Management Banking Specialists have access to industry leading financial solutions and a team of dedicated product specialists – all designed to meet the unique life priorities of clients – priorities like managing operating expense, building wealth, financing, managing debt, buying a home, saving for college or planning for unexpected life events.  

Training is provided by our award-winning Academy at Bank of America. This program delivers hands-on practice, personalized coaching and classes that will help Wealth Management Banking Specialists become the specialists they want to be. With demonstrated success, there is career growth and the opportunity to advance in many roles within our company.

In this interactive webcast our team will:

•	Share Bank of America benefits
•	Offer candid insight on personal career experience
•	Show the extensive opportunities available with Bank of America/Merrill Lynch 

Event Times:
•	7:00pm-8:00pm ET
•	6:00pm-7:00pm CST
•	4:00 pm–5:00 pm PT

Registration for this event is required. After registration, and up to 24 hours prior to the event, email reminders will be sent to include dial-in information for the webinar.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/517.name: Yelping From Home: The Tech Talk Series
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/517.location: Any Handshake student with a link to this event can view and RSVP
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/517.description:
***Please RSVP via Eventbrite***

Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses, and one of the teams working behind the scenes to make that happen is our five star engineering and product teams.

Playing an active role in our community is a value that we have strongly prioritized over the years. Typically we would invite you to come to Yelp’s HQ to network, grab a slice of ‘za, and learn about the technology and culture behind Yelp. With stay-at-home orders across the globe, Yelp (like many of you) has had no choice but to adapt to these changes. We understand that this is a strange and challenging time for many, so we’d like to invite you to join us as we navigate this new normal for the tech community together.

To stay connected, create space for folks to collaborate and share some of the things Yelp has been working on, we are launching our very own virtual tech talk series. This series of talks will feature Yelpers from engineering and product and will focus on themes such as career development, technical skills, workplace challenges and Yelp’s response to COVID-19.

Emil Hessel, Product Manager
Talk: Good Products in Tough Times

2020 has fundamentally transformed the landscape for local businesses and the customers they serve. For many of us, where and how we get food, shop, and even exercise are dramatically different than they were four months ago. With this, the need to stay up-to-date and connected with the businesses in our communities is more universal than ever. One of Yelp's newest products, Yelp Connect, is designed to fill this need. Join us as we talk about how we built an idea into a product used by thousands of businesses to help in their fight for survival. We'll explain what Yelp Connect is, how it's helping businesses and consumers in today's environment, and some key product insights we picked up along the way.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/515.name: Getting career-ready whilst making a difference; globally, domestically or virtually.
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/515.description:
Secure practical skills and industry experience that put you ahead of the graduate pack, whilst achieving a sustainable social impact with an internship that you can do internationally, in rural Australia, or from the comfort of your home! 

At Project Everest Ventures, we believe that tackling global challenges won't be achieved by doing what's always been done before. With three  unique Impact Programs, this is your chance to tailor your own personal and professional growth, gain skills that top recruiters crave, and do work experience that’s not only good...but good for the world.

Join recent graduates, Abbey and Alice, as they discuss their own experiences of working in international development in a variety of roles with Project Everest, and how they’ve used these skills to cement a successful and fulfilling career path. They’ll be covering topics such as:
· The UN’s Sustainable Development Goals as collective targetsfor the next 10 years
· The current state of the world and the importance of these goals for the future of mankind
· The issues with charity and government when addressing these challenges
· The concept of of social enterprise and how business can change the world 
· The nature of the working world for grads and how you can effectively prepare during uni.
· Specifics on how Project Everest  operates in this space; our impact projects and opportunities for students
· Live Q&A

Too many young people report feelings of helplessness when facing the issues of our time; feeling excluded, helpless or incapable of making a real difference. 

Hear genuine stories and advice from new STEM graduates, who utilised the available opportunities during their studies to build out their skills, networks and confidence, and ultimately securing graduate employment with a leading social enterprise. 

You’ll leave this session having a better understanding of how business has a core role to play in tackling the today’s biggest challenges, the potential for young minds to greatly contribute and get stuck into making their mark on the world, and the work Project Everest is currently doing: globally and online.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/499.location: Any Handshake student with a link to this event can view and RSVP
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/499.description:
Join us on July 16 at 2-3 p.m. ET for the third of a six-part live chat series with fellows. Get answers to your questions from current fellows and staff! Hear what it's like to be a fellow in all three branches of the federal government.

The AAAS Science & Technology Policy Fellowships is a paid, yearlong opportunity for professional development and public service for outstanding scientists, social scientists and engineers. Fellows come from a wide range of disciplines, sectors and career stages. Fellows are postdocs, faculty on sabbatical, and other scientists and engineers looking to develop new skills as they grow in their careers.

The AAAS S&T Policy Fellowships (STPF) are open to U.S. citizens who hold doctoral-level degrees in any of the following:

• Biological, Physical or Earth Sciences.
• Medical and Health Sciences.
• Social and Behavioral Sciences.
• Computational, Information & Data Sciences.
• Mathematics & Statistics.

Individuals with a MS in Engineering plus three years of professional experience are also eligible for this program.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.name: GSA Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning End-User License Agreement Challenge 2020
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.description:
GSA Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning End-User License Agreement Challenge 2020


 TOTAL CASH PRIZES OFFERED: $20,000
 TYPE OF CHALLENGE: Software and apps
 SUBMISSION START: 07/06/2020 10:00 AM ET
 SUBMISSION END: 08/20/2020 05:00 PM ET

Description

The goal of this challenge is to develop an artificial intelligence (AI), or machine learning (ML) solution that will review end-user license agreements (EULA) for terms and conditions that are unacceptable to the government. On average it takes all parties involved approximately 7-14 days to review an EULA and ensure that all unacceptable terms and conditions are identified.

A EULA details the rights and restrictions which apply to the use of software or services. It can also be known as a software license agreement or acceptable use policy. As part of the acquisition process of software or services, GSA reviews the associated EULAs. This review must be completed prior to awarding new contracts or modifying existing contracts. A GSA contracting officer (CO) reviews applicable EULAs for terms and conditions that are not in accordance with Federal law and regulations. The CO may also coordinate a legal review with the Office of General Counsel if they feel it is warranted. Should EULAs contain language that would conflict with Federal law and regulations, the CO must negotiate changes to the EULA to remove the problematic language.

We are looking for a solution that will use AI and/or ML to improve this manual process. The solution will include a user interface that GSA will use to process the documents and identify unacceptable clauses/terms in the EULAs. Watch our AI / ML challenge video to learn more about the desired solution.

This solution will decrease the time spent manually reviewing EULAs and free resources to focus on other aspects of the acquisition process. It will also improve the accuracy and consistency of the review process.


Youtube video announcing GSA ML/AI Challenge - https://youtu.be/uOBFIqoOJ8k

Website with complete details - https://www.challenge.gov/challenge/GSA-artificial-intelligence-AI-machine-learning-ML-challenge/

Key Facts:
·      Registration begins: 10 a.m. ET, July 6, 2020
·      Submit solutions before: 5 p.m. ET, August 20, 2020
·      Semi-finalists announced: 10 a.m. ET, September 4, 2020
·      Winner announced: 10 a.m. ET, September 11, 2020
·      Each challenge solver (individual, team, or legal entity) is required to register by sending an email to challenge2020@gsa.gov with the subject line stating ‘Challenge 2020 Registration’.

·      Cash prizes for winning teams:
o  1st place team: $15,000.00
o  2nd place team: $2,500.00
o  3rd place team: $2,500.00

·      Questions? emailchallenge2020@gsa.gov for more information.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.name: Yelping From Home: The Tech Talk Series
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.description:
To stay connected, create space for folks to collaborate and share some of the things Yelp has been working on, we are launching our very own virtual tech talk series. This series of talks will feature Yelpers from engineering and product and will focus on themes such as career development, technical skills, workplace challenges and Yelp’s response to COVID-19.

Talk: Creating Meaningful Data Through Rich Contextual Logging Across Microservice

As engineers, we need data to support our decisions. However, it is a huge step from “we have data” to “we have meaningful data”. At Yelp, we use contextual logging to allow data consumers to connect any data sources. In this talk, Kangni will talk about how contextual logging is adopted across Yelp’s microservices via context propagation, and the challenges we encountered.

Kangni Wang
Bio: Kangni has been a software engineer on the experimentation team at Yelp for the last 2.5 years. Prior to Yelp, she completed her Bachelor's degree in Computer Science at Harvey Mudd College.

Talk: Fuelling Your Career With Coffee Chats

One of the best ways to meet people and launch your career is to set up short chats over coffee. But, there are no guidelines and it can be daunting to start. We'll go over the individual stages of a coffee chat, from asking someone to transforming it into a mentorship. You’ll pick up tools to have meaningful conversations and walk away with a game plan to get started!

Sherry Yuan
Bio: Sherry is an Android engineer at Yelp working on the Yelp for Business Owners Android app. Prior to starting at Yelp, she studied computer science at the University of British Columbia, where she started a coffee chat program with Daphne. She is passionate about Android development, diversity in tech, and creative and technical writing.

Daphne Liu
Bio: Daphne is an Android engineer who enjoys meeting new people and branching out outside her team. She shares her interests in tech, mentorship and diversity by speaking at conferences, writing blogs, and being involved with the Women in CS club she founded at her university. She is currently finishing up her last year of school at the University of British Columbia.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/525.name: Yelping From Home: The Tech Talk Series
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/525.description:
**Please RSVP through Eventbrite**

Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses, and one of the teams working behind the scenes to make that happen is our five star engineering and product teams.

Playing an active role in our community is a value that we have strongly prioritized over the years. Typically we would invite you to come to Yelp’s HQ to network, grab a slice of ‘za, and learn about the technology and culture behind Yelp. With stay-at-home orders across the globe, Yelp (like many of you) has had no choice but to adapt to these changes. We understand that this is a strange and challenging time for many, so we’d like to invite you to join us as we navigate this new normal for the tech community together.

To stay connected, create space for folks to collaborate and share some of the things Yelp has been working on, we are launching our very own virtual tech talk series. This series of talks will feature Yelpers from engineering and product and will focus on themes such as career development, technical skills, workplace challenges and Yelp’s response to COVID-19.

Talk: Why you should pursue public speaking and how to get there

Starting a tech career as a minority is challenging. It could mean being the only one to speak against the popular opinion, or becoming more visible to get the same level of recognition.

Public speaking helps you achieve that and more. This talk shares tips on how to overcome the fear and ways to get started. Attendees will be prepared to brace for presenting from a team meeting to a conference.Yenny Cheung

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.name: GSA Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning End-User License Agreement Challenge 2020
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/521.description:
GSA Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning End-User License Agreement Challenge 2020


 TOTAL CASH PRIZES OFFERED: $20,000
 TYPE OF CHALLENGE: Software and apps
 SUBMISSION START: 07/06/2020 10:00 AM ET
 SUBMISSION END: 08/20/2020 05:00 PM ET

Description

The goal of this challenge is to develop an artificial intelligence (AI), or machine learning (ML) solution that will review end-user license agreements (EULA) for terms and conditions that are unacceptable to the government. On average it takes all parties involved approximately 7-14 days to review an EULA and ensure that all unacceptable terms and conditions are identified.

A EULA details the rights and restrictions which apply to the use of software or services. It can also be known as a software license agreement or acceptable use policy. As part of the acquisition process of software or services, GSA reviews the associated EULAs. This review must be completed prior to awarding new contracts or modifying existing contracts. A GSA contracting officer (CO) reviews applicable EULAs for terms and conditions that are not in accordance with Federal law and regulations. The CO may also coordinate a legal review with the Office of General Counsel if they feel it is warranted. Should EULAs contain language that would conflict with Federal law and regulations, the CO must negotiate changes to the EULA to remove the problematic language.

We are looking for a solution that will use AI and/or ML to improve this manual process. The solution will include a user interface that GSA will use to process the documents and identify unacceptable clauses/terms in the EULAs. Watch our AI / ML challenge video to learn more about the desired solution.

This solution will decrease the time spent manually reviewing EULAs and free resources to focus on other aspects of the acquisition process. It will also improve the accuracy and consistency of the review process.


Youtube video announcing GSA ML/AI Challenge - https://youtu.be/uOBFIqoOJ8k

Website with complete details - https://www.challenge.gov/challenge/GSA-artificial-intelligence-AI-machine-learning-ML-challenge/

Key Facts:
·      Registration begins: 10 a.m. ET, July 6, 2020
·      Submit solutions before: 5 p.m. ET, August 20, 2020
·      Semi-finalists announced: 10 a.m. ET, September 4, 2020
·      Winner announced: 10 a.m. ET, September 11, 2020
·      Each challenge solver (individual, team, or legal entity) is required to register by sending an email to challenge2020@gsa.gov with the subject line stating ‘Challenge 2020 Registration’.

·      Cash prizes for winning teams:
o  1st place team: $15,000.00
o  2nd place team: $2,500.00
o  3rd place team: $2,500.00

·      Questions? emailchallenge2020@gsa.gov for more information.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/534.description:
The Intelligence Community is hosting their 2020 Virtual Career Fair on Thursday, August 13th from 1-7 PM (Eastern).   

For many agencies, they are only accepting applications through this program, so it’s important to participate.  If you are looking for an internship or full-time job within the intelligence community, you should attend this event!  

During the fair, you can:
•	Visit agency booths to explore available job opportunities
•	Chat with recruiters and subject matter experts
•	Learn about internships and other student opportunities

Who will be there?
•	Office of the Director of National Intelligence (ODNI)
•	Central Intelligence Agency (CIA)
•	Defense Intelligence Agency (DIA)
•	Department of Energy (DOE)
•	Department of Homeland Security Office of Intelligence and Analysis (DHS I&A)
•	Department of State (DOS)/Bureau of Intelligence and Research
•	Department of the Treasury
•	Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA)
•	Federal Bureau of Investigation (FBI)
•	National Geospatial-Intelligence Agency (NGA)
•	National Reconnaissance Office (NRO)
•	National Security Agency (NSA)
•	U.S. Air Force
•	U.S. Army
•	U.S. Coast Guard
•	U.S. Marine Corps

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/career_fai.description:
Heinz College Public Service Fair
The Public Service Fair is an opportunity for Heinz students to find local non-profit and government organizations to find remote intern, work study, or volunteer positions during the fall and spring semesters. Many organizations in attendance hire through the paid Federal Community Service Work Study program. Others provide excellent volunteer opportunities. This is a great opportunity to find meaningful practical experience that you can add to your resume.
*Federal Community Service Work Study program is only open to US Citizens*
A representative from each organization will be available to discuss internship and volunteer opportunities with their organization. It is possible to find a position, or at the very least network with organizations you find interesting. Even though all these organizations are in the non-profit/government sectors, they need a wide range of Heinz talent including: project management, marketing, outreach, development, IT and policy analysts.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/499.description:
Join us on August 20 at 1-2 p.m. ET for the fourth of a six-part live chat series with fellows. Get answers to your questions from current fellows and staff!

The AAAS Science & Technology Policy Fellowships is a paid, yearlong opportunity for professional development and public service for outstanding scientists, social scientists and engineers. Fellows come from a wide range of disciplines, sectors and career stages. Fellows are postdocs, faculty on sabbatical, and other scientists and engineers looking to develop new skills as they grow in their careers.

The AAAS S&T Policy Fellowships (STPF) are open to U.S. citizens who hold doctoral-level degrees in any of the following:

• Biological, Physical or Earth Sciences.
• Medical and Health Sciences.
• Social and Behavioral Sciences.
• Computational, Information & Data Sciences.
• Mathematics & Statistics.

Individuals with a MS in Engineering plus three years of professional experience are also eligible for this program.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/546.name: *Olitsky Family Foundation Career Readiness Program at CMU
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/546.description:
CMU is committed to providing a culture of inclusion and breaking down barriers that inhibit our students, of all needs and abilities, from reaching their personal, academic and professional potential. The goal of The Olitsky Family Foundation Career Readiness Program is to break down the barriers-of-entry for students with emotional and cognitive differences in their career-search process. Students with autism, ADHD, and other neurodiverse identities have been known to benefit from this program in the past. We achieve this goal by engaging and educating 1) students, 2) the campus community, and 3) employer partners. Through 1-on-1 coaching and event programming, we assist students in navigating workplace disclosure and accommodations, job search anxiety, time management, goal setting, interview skills, and more. 

As part of this program, you will have the opportunity to engage in the following opportunities.  Additional details and workshops details will be shared on our website: https://www.cmu.edu/career/students-and-alumni/diversity-and-career-readiness/index.html

1) Work 1-on-1 with a career coach to develop an individualized plan and to build the skills needed for resume writing, job/internship searching, interviewing, and any other career development topic you wish to discuss.

2) Participate in Olitsky career readiness workshops throughout the fall and spring semesters to enhance your professional knowledge and skills. Through these workshops, you will have the opportunity to learn about the job search process, network with employers, and improve other career development skills (i.e., self-advocacy in the workplace, pathway exploration, nurturing mental throughout a job search, interview skills, and more).

3) Engage in Student-Employer Connect Events to network with local employers in a structured and risk-free environment. These events will allow you to apply your professional skills while seeking job/internship opportunities for further career growth.

Please contact Joe Battelline with questions about this program and specific workshop dates at jbattell@andrew.cmu.eduView full description

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/548.name: Yelping From Home: The Tech Talk Series
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/548.location: Any Handshake student with a link to this event can view and RSVP
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/548.description:
Yelp’s mission is to connect people with great local businesses, and one of the teams working behind the scenes to make that happen is our five star engineering and product teams.

Playing an active role in our community is a value that we have strongly prioritized over the years. Typically we would invite you to come to Yelp’s HQ to network, grab a slice of ‘za, and learn about the technology and culture behind Yelp. With stay-at-home orders across the globe, Yelp (like many of you) has had no choice but to adapt to these changes. We understand that this is a strange and challenging time for many, so we’d like to invite you to join us as we navigate this new normal for the tech community together.

To stay connected, create space for folks to collaborate and share some of the things Yelp has been working on, we are launching our very own virtual tech talk series. This series of talks will feature Yelpers from engineering and product and will focus on themes such as career development, technical skills, workplace challenges and Yelp’s response to COVID-19.

Speaker:
Prerna Manaktala, San Francisco

Bio: After 10 years in the industry, I joined Yelp as an Android developer in 2017 on the Reader Experience team and moved to Growth as a proto manager in March this year. It's been a great learning experience at Yelp for me, and I have grown in my technical, ownership, and leadership skills with the opportunities given by my managers. I love working with my awesome team and am grateful for working in a company which has such a great culture.

Talk: Estimations: Pitfalls and How To Bounce Back

At school, every project has certain requirements and a deadline for submission. But when we start a career in tech, we are expected to execute small projects. As we gain experience, we face the challenge of delivering bigger projects on time. This dialog will focus on why accurate estimation is important and how good estimates and project execution skills can help early and mid-career attendees feel empowered to tackle challenges.

Moderator:
Kevin Knaust, San Francisco

Bio: Kevin is currently a technical recruiting manager and has worked in both sales and recruiting roles over the past nine years at Yelp. He manages various recruiting operations and leadership & development projects like Yelp's Engineering Mentorship Program and has worked extensively with undergraduate students through the Yelp Intern Program and university recruiting. He enjoys discovering new music, reading science fiction, and soccer.

Here's a bit more about Zscaler: 

For over 10 years, Zscaler has been disrupting and transforming the security industry. Our 100% purpose built cloud platform delivers the entire gateway security stack as a service through 150 global data centers to securely connect users to their applications, regardless of device, location, or network in over 185 countries protecting over 3,500 companies and 100 Million threats detected a day.

We work in a fast paced, dynamic and make it happen culture. Our people are some of the brightest and passionate in the industry that thrive on being the first to solve problems.  We are always looking to hire highly passionate, collaborative and humble people that want to make a difference.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/549.description:
Join us to:
1) Learn more about FAST Enterprises - recognized as one of the Best Places to Work for diversity, millennial's and technology!
2) Create or update your technical resume. Hear from Taylor Kreider, Recruiter at FAST, on how to craft a better technical resume, that will get a hiring manager's attention.

Why should I attend?
- The Dos and Don’ts of a technical resume
- Learn what hiring managers are looking for in a technical resume
- Organize and showcase your technical skills on a resume so that they stand out
- Learn about available positions and qualities they look for in candidates
- Gain insight into various career paths
- Assess the company and its culture
- This is a great way to prepare your resume for the upcoming Career Fair on September 14th!



ABOUT FAST ENTERPRISES
FAST is an industry leader in the development and installation of software for government agencies. In 1998 we forever changed the way government revenue agencies support their business with the introduction of GenTax®. This commercial off the shelf (COTS) solution has enabled many agencies to take advantage of package implementations, providing more cost-efficient and fully functional software systems to our clients. We have expanded beyond tax and now do implementations for Motor Vehicle, Drivers License, Unemployment Insurance and Unemployment Benefit agencies.
Much of the work at FAST happens on our client sites as part of the product implementation. Individuals who understand the technical aspects of systems implementation, as well as the business needs of our clients, fill these positions. Employees participate in the full project life cycle from requirements gathering through production support.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/499.name: Vatic Labs Virtual Information Session
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/499.description:
We are Vatic Labs where Quantitative Researchers, Algorithmic Traders and Technologists collaborate to develop autonomous trading agents and cutting-edge technology and apply it to the financial markets. The nature of the problems we work on are challenging, hence we hire some of the world's top computer scientists and researchers to develop novel AI methods and trading strategies. Our environment is highly collaborative, fostering innovation and growth. Our team includes several leading academic researchers (MIT, CMU, CalTech, and Stanford), as well as International Olympiad and ACM ICPC gold medalists. We are passionate about hiring the best and the brightest, empowering them with the tools and mentorship needed to be successful. Our environment is highly collaborative, fostering innovation and growth and the ability for new graduates to have impact. 

As Quantitative Researcher: You will contribute to the research and development of fully autonomous trading agents with some of the brightest researchers, traders, and technologists in the world. You will apply cutting edge machine learning and artificial intelligence algorithms to vast amounts of market data to discover and capitalize on trading opportunities. 

As an Algo Trader: You will research and develop innovative and quantitative strategies. You will explore vast amounts of market data, applying advanced machine learning/AI methods and statistical approaches to discover and capitalize on trading opportunities.  

As a Software Engineer: You will build innovative technology at the forefront of low-latency and distributed computing systems, have the opportunity to work on technology at all levels of the stack, including everything from low-level system/network development to algorithmic development (C/C++ & Python) on Linux. 

If this sounds exciting to you please visit our website www.vaticlabs.ai.

You can register for the event directly via this Zoom link: https://us02web.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_yiX7OaJhR0CJ0JyX_CQfUA

● Uploading resumes into the virtual platform in advance to give employers more time to review your qualifications, which increases your opportunity to stand out.● Checking the CareerEco platform ahead of time to more efficiently and effectively identify the employers that are the best fit for you, which allows you to easily identify the most important details you need to know.● Accessing more companies than could traditionally be accommodated in-person, which means more opportunities will be available to you in a broader array of majors.● No waiting in line, which gives you the ability to talk to more employers and provides more flexibility to easily come and go.Lastly, the CPDC will be providingmoreinformationonhowtoprepforthevirtualcareerfair aswell asotherhelpful information asitgetsclosertotheevent.We are excited about this fall’s recruiting and look forward to your participation!Learn more about CareerEco (Virtual Fair Platform):Virtual Event Tutorial PDFVirtual Event Tutorial VideoQuestions?

Amazon Robotics, a wholly owned subsidiary of Amazon.com, empowers a smarter, faster, more consistent customer experience through automation. Amazon Robotics automates fulfilment center operations using various methods of robotic technology including autonomous mobile robots, sophisticated control software, language perception, power management, computer vision, depth sensing, machine learning, object recognition, and semantic understanding of commands.

Amazon Robotics has a dedicated focus on research and development to continuously explore new opportunities to extend its product lines into new areas that will redefine what ‘Now’ means and allow Amazon to continue to offer customer experiences that will delight and amaze.

Headquartered in the Boston area, Amazon Robotics is located in the epicenter of robotic innovation and has developing corporate and academic partnerships to support innovation throughout the robotics ecosystem, to bring cutting edge technology into the field faster.

This Tech Talk is targeted for students in the School of Computer Science & the College of Engineering.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/533.name: Virtual Info Session
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/533.description:
We live in an era of data breaches and account takeovers (Equifax, Twitter, etc). The stakes are high, but so are the rewards for innovators who can defend consumers and enterprises against the consequences of these attacks. UnifyID has the bold vision to replace today's vulnerable and cumbersome security techniques (passwords, one-time passcodes, etc), with passive, behavior-based authentication. UnifyID has created the next generation of user authentication that combines behavioral biometrics from smartphones, machine learning, and enterprise-grade cloud services. The result is a highly accurate, frictionless, and secure authentication service that defends against malicious scale attacks on mobile and web experiences.

We are a talented team of security, machine learning, mobile, and enterprise SaaS experts backed by leading investors such as NEA, Andreessen Horowitz, and Stanford-StartX. Our innovations have won numerous awards from TechCrunch, RSA, Gartner, and SXSW. We are seeking passionate, self-motivated individuals who are ready to dive into crafting the future of authentication. We encourage and support everyone on the UnifyID team to be proactive, collaborate, teach, and learn. UnifyID is located in the heart of Silicon Valley in downtown Redwood City and has unparalleled access to deep entrepreneurial expertise, high-caliber academic research institutions, and top-tier VC resources. Finally, it is important that you be authentic and be yourself. UnifyID is an equal opportunity employer.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/550.name: Heinz College: How to Network Like A Rockstar with Jaymin Patel
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/550.description:
HEINZ COLLEGE STUDENTS ONLY:

How to Network Like A Rockstar
Presented by Heinz Alumnus Jaymin J. Patel – Multi-Book Author & Founder of The Network of Rockstars

Are YOU the Rockstar candidate that top firms are looking for? Most people think they know networking, but Jaymin will show you how to stand out among top caliber candidates by networking like a Rockstar! Jaymin has presented The Rockstar Approach to packed rooms across the US, and internationally at schools like Harvard, Wharton, Stanford and University of Toronto. Go beyond that 8.5’ x 11’ piece of paper called a resume - Jaymin presents the must do’s and what -not-to-do’s of networking to build meaningful and lasting personal relationships in professional settings and achieve your career goals.

Jaymin has developed a “science” behind networking that is framed for the analytical mind of graduate and undergraduate students and helps break down the nebulous concept of networking. He will share tips and tricks collected from dozens of MBAs, undergraduate students, and industry professionals on their journey to get their dream job – including his own personal successes and failures as a Student and Recruiter.

Jaymin will help you:
- Build confidence in talking to anyone
- Understand what a recruiter is really thinking and how they really make decisions
- Clearly articulate their career goals and definition of career success
- Identify the right individuals to network with
- Understand the 11 Attributes of an Rockstar Candidate that firms are looking for
- Self-assess and determine if they are a Rockstar Candidate
- Develop lasting personal relationships with influential individuals
- “Work the room” with ease and finesse at networking receptions and Career Fairs (especially in a “circle of death” situation)
- And most importantly… Understand what NOT to do, what to do, and when

THIS EVENT IS VIRTUAL. USE ZOOM URL PROVIDED AT THE TIME OF THE EVENT.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/546.name: Advanced Analytics Development Program - John Hancock Virtual Information Session - CMU
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/546.description:
The Advanced Analytics team at John Hancock is inviting you to a session to discuss employment opportunities through their Advanced analytics Development Program (AADP).

AADP is a two-year rotational program that provides graduates with the opportunity to work on multi-dimensional, complex analytics initiatives across all lines of business at John Hancock: insurance, retirement, wealth management and investments; with global geographies: US, Canada, Asia. The program is a full-time employment opportunity for individuals nearing their graduation in a scientific, engineering, or any quantitative discipline, and who have interests in pursuing a career in data science and/or data engineering.

During this session, representatives of the Advanced Analytics team will discuss the program, current data science initiatives at John Hancock, and give you an overview of data science career paths in their organization.

Fellowships Available: Protect our nation’s security as a Department of Energy NNSA Graduate Fellow. NGFP is seeking highly motivated graduate-level students to grow as the next generation of national security leaders. The one-year, salaried (with benefits) fellowships offer:
• Hands-on experience in national security and nonproliferation;
• Career development, professional networking, and specialized training events; and

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/541.name: Life Sciences Future – BioPharm (full conference - Complimentary Passes)
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/541.description:
Life Sciences Future – BioPharm is a virtual conference hosted Wednesday, September 30, 2020 through Friday, October 2, 2020 each morning. However, all sessions are recorded and can be viewed at any time!  The conference will focus on various topics within the biotechnology and pharmaceutical industries.  The types of sessions include live sessions followed by zoom networking to interact with the speaker, on demand sessions viewable at any time, one-on-one partnering and much more.  This is your FREE chance to experience a life science industry conference, get to know companies in the field, learn from experts, and interact with companies to potentially form a relationship leading to an internship or future career path.  Complimentary passes sponsored by over ten companies to increase attendance from underrepresented individuals.

Below are some of the topics and speakers already confirmed:

-	COVID-19: Second Wave and What to Expect, presented by David B. Nash, MD, MBA, Founding Dean Emeritus at Jefferson College of Population Health, Thomas Jefferson University
-	The Continuing Story: COVID 19 Direct from the Front Lines, presented by Ian L. Valerio, MD, MS, MBA, Fellow, American College of Surgeons (FACS), Captain (sel), Medical Corps, US Navy Reserve
-	JLabs: Who We Are, What We Do, presented by Stephen Pitt, Ph.D., Head of Johnson & Johnson Innovation, JLABS US North East, Johnson & Johnson Innovation
-	Supply Chain Globalization or Localization in a Post-Pandemic Era? Presented by Albert W. DeRitis, Assistant Clinical Professor, LeBow College of Business, Drexel University

For more information and to see a list of speakers please visit: http://lifesciencesfuture.net/

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/547.name: Life of a PDT Quantitative Researcher: From Academia to Industry @ CMU (PhD)
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/547.description:
Curious what it means to be a Quantitative Researcher at PDT Partners? Join our moderated discussion with PDT researchers to learn about their journey to quantitative finance from academia. They will discuss their career path, the interesting work that challenges them and their decision to come to the quantitative finance industry. Learn how a team of scientists, mathematicians and engineers with PhDs in Physics, Computer Science, Statistics and Electrical Engineering develop trading strategies using uniquely scientifically rigorous approaches in an open and collaborative culture.
 
We will discuss how PDT and quantitative research compares to other industries, our academic research culture and how researchers use the skills from their graduate program to tackle interesting and challenging problems. This will be an interactive discussion and you will hear directly from PDTers!
 
Here are the PDT researchers on our panel:

Sudeep
Sudeep joined PDT after a postdoctoral position with the Center for Science of Information at Princeton University. Sudeep has a PhD in Electrical Engineering and Computer Science from UC Berkeley and a Bachelors in Electrical Engineering from IIT Bombay. Sudeep is now a researcher in our research community.

Gerald
Gerald joined PDT’s research community after completing his PhD in Management Science and engineering from Stanford University. His research was focused on methods for simulating of stochastic processes with applications to options pricing.View full description

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/549.name: SIG: Meet a Buy Side Research Analyst
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/549.location: Any Handshake student with a link to this event can view and RSVP
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/549.description:
Do you have an interest in the financial markets, a love of competition, and a desire to work in a fast-paced environment? We invite you to join us to learn about Susquehanna International Group (SIG) and our Buy Side Research team. 

During this event, we’ll give you a glimpse of what a day in the life of a research analyst looks like, from creating in-depth company analyses to providing real-time opinions on breaking news throughout the trading day. Following a brief presentation, you will have the opportunity to speak with current analysts and former interns who will share their experience and answer any questions you have about SIG and buy side research. 

This event is open to anyone who is interested in learning more about the industry. 

RSVP
Registration for this event is closed. If you are interested in attending future events, please email becca.topel@sig.com. 

ABOUT SIG
SIG is a global quantitative trading firm founded with a growth mindset and an analytical approach to decision making. We bring together the brightest minds, the best tech, and the most expansive library of data in the industry. Only by tapping into our diverse perspectives, can we truly reach our potential. At the end of the day, by thinking together we achieve winning results.

WHAT WE DO
Committing our own capital, we trade financial products around the globe. We improve the financial markets by providing liquidity and ensuring competitive prices for buyers and sellers. Working collaboratively and leveraging each other’s strengths, we build virtually all of our own trading technology from scratch to implement our quantitative trading strategies that make us leaders in high performance, low latency trading.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/545.name: PwC + CMU Lecture Series: Social Engineering
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/545.description:
Think before you click! Social Engineering is an effective method used by hackers to get around security obstacles by leveraging natural human tendencies and emotional reactions to steal your credentials and gain unauthorized access to your personal accounts. A skilled social engineer has many tactics to perform a social engineering attack - does “phishing” sound familiar? Come join us for a cybersecurity discussion on Social Engineering hosted by PwC leadership, and learn how you can outsmart these hackers by taking a few precautions. 

Following the lecture, we invite you to join us 1:1 for a virtual (or real!) cup of coffee to discuss your career aspirations, learn about consulting careers in Cybersecurity, ‘real-world’ work-life balance, and the ‘new normal. Sign up for a 15 minute Coffee Chat with a PwC professional between 2pm and 4pm ET.  For details and sign up links, please refer to the following Handshake event link: https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/553229

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/524.name: Intelligent Systems Presentation on Robotics, Unmanned Systems, and related tech
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/524.description:
Event link: 
https://swri.webex.com/swri/j.php?MTID=m5056609b6da86c98f3b562ef8e69ee92
Hear from the Intelligent Systems Vice President on SwRI's tech capabilities and the internal research we pursue to benefit humanity. Southwest Research Institute, founded in 1947, is an independent, nonprofit, applied research and development organization dedicated to pursuing innovation while benefiting humanity.  We pursue over 4,000 projects a year including our own internal research and development. Our SA, Texas campus has 1500 acres of state-of-the-art facilities and lab space to create and design in.  The SwRI family consists of more than 2600 staff members, within 9 different technical divisions. We pursue projects in deep sea to deep space, and everything in between! 
SwRI is a leader in machine learning methods development, assessment, and systems integration using the following methods, among others:
Deep learning & Neural Networks – Development of complex, memory intensive neural networks.
Computer vision – Visual data are used to identify images and categorize individual characteristics and spectra features down to the pixel.
Machine Learning Applications
Our machine learning applications are as diverse as the clients we serve. Visit Client Services for a comprehensive list of industry solutions or these specific machine learning applications:
Biomedical & Healthcare
Human Performance Solutions
Bioinformatics & Computer-aided Diagnostics
Machine Vision & Autonomous Robotics
Automation Solutions
Automated Driving Systems & UGVs
Industrial Robotics & Automation
Perception Technologies for Dynamic Environments
Energy & Environment
Methane Leak Detection
Mass Spec Data Analysis
Data Analytics
Complex Data Analysis
Science Operations & Data Analysis
Data Analytics & Machine Learning

We streamline maintenance processes and implement new designs and software and provide custom training technology for government and industry clients in the aerospace industry. We specialize in modernizing, overhauling, and rejuvenating aging electronic and aerospace systems, particularly for the U.S. military. We work with U.S. and foreign government agencies and commercial clients.
For more than three decades, Southwest Research Institute (SwRI) has been a recognized leader in space science research as well as in the development of spacecraft instrumentation, avionics and electronics for both government and industry. A traditional strength of the Space Science Department is the design and fabrication of instruments for the in-situ measurement of space plasmas, the dilute ionized gases that populate the immediate space environments of the Earth and other solar system bodies as well as interplanetary space.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/558.description:
Heinz College Federal Government Week
Monday, September 21 - 12:00PM ET

Keynote Speaker: 
The Emergence of Public Interest Technology 
~Krista Kinnard, General Service Administration, Director AI Center of Excellence

Krista Kinnard (MSPPM-DA ’17) is Director at the Artificial Intelligence Center of Excellence in the Technology Transformation Services within the General Services Administration.  During this session, Krista will highlight her journey from Heinz student to IBM consultant, and her current work with the Technology Transformation Services at GSA.  She will also discuss the future of public interest technology and actionable next steps for Heinz students interested in Federal service and public interest tech.

Krista Kinnard is a Director at the Artificial Intelligence Center of Excellence in the Technology Transformation Services within GSA. Since 2019, she has led the team that is enabling agencies to develop AI solutions to meet unique business challenges by incorporating machine learning, computer vision, natural language processing, intelligent process design, and robotic process automation (RPA) across the organization. Krista also serves as the AI lead with the Artificial Intelligence Community of Practice (CoP). The AI CoP is a government-wide Community of Practice (CoP) harnessing the advancements and accelerating the adoption of AI across the federal government.  Before joining Artificial Intelligence Center of Excellence, Krista worked as a data scientist where she partnered with federal agencies to build AI solutions

A part of the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, NIH is the largest biomedical research agency in the world.  NIH's main campus is located in Bethesda, Maryland just a few miles outside of Washington, DC. 
The mission is to seek fundamental knowledge about the nature and behavior of living systems and the application of that knowledge to enhance health, lengthen life, and reduce illness and disability.
NIH is made up of 27 Institutes and Centers, each with a specific research agenda, often focusing on particular diseases or body systems. 
More detailed information about the NIH can be found at: www.nih.gov.  If you are interested our job opportunities and student internships, please visit: https://hr.nih.gov/jobs.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/553.name: Boren Awards Info Session
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/553.description:
Boren Awards 2020

This session is open to all CMU students.

The Boren Awards (borenawards.org) fund undergraduate and graduate study of less commonly taught languages in world regions critical to U.S. interests, and underrepresented in study abroad, including Africa, Asia, Central and Eastern Europe, Eurasia, Latin America.

Attend this session to learn more about Boren Scholarships and Boren Fellowships.  Our speaker will be Michael Saffle, Boren Awards Program Specialist.  He will go over the basics of what Boren is, and what they are looking for in an applicants. He'll help students locate the most useful information on their website.  Michael will take Q&A throughout the presentation.

This live event will give students the chance to pick the brain of a Boren team member who has been involved in the program for years.  Take advantage of this opportunity to get first-hand knowledge of the programs and applications.

BOREN SCHOLARSHIPS
Fund study abroad by U.S. undergraduate students in world regions critical to U.S. interests. Maximum awards are determined by duration abroad:
Up to $25,000 for 25-52 weeks (preferred)
Up to $12,500 for 12-24 weeks
Up to $8,000 for 8-11 weeks (STEM majors only)

BOREN FELLOWSHIPS
Fund research and language study proposals by U.S. graduate students in world regions critical to U.S. interests.  Maximum awards are determined by duration abroad:
Up to $25,000 for 25-52 weeks (preferred) 
Up to $12,500 for 12-24 weeks
+ Up to $12,000 for domestic language study (optional)

Register Now!
Registration is now open for the Spark Virtual Career Fair! We hope you register and join the fair and sign up for 1:1 and group meetings with numerous employers.
SparkSpark: Startups and Emerging Companiesis an innovative virtual career event designed to provide a platform for small business and early stage start-ups to engage Carnegie Mellon University students and alumni. Companies will be afforded the opportunity to network with, and recruit our students and alumni, as well as share information about their company story, mission, and/or products with all in attendance. Spark is presented in collaboration with CMU’s Swartz Center For Entrepreneurship.

We are using the Handshake Virtual Career Fair platformAs you prepare for the fair, it’s important that you register for employer sessions in advance. You can only attend sessions you registered for. Check out this article to learn how to register.
Some employers have set qualifications to define which students can register for their sessions. To ensure you qualify for employer sessions, make sure you have filled out the following fields on your profile:
School year, major and GPA, which can be found on your profile
Work authorization status, which can be found on the Privacy & Settings page
Here are some additional resources to help you prepare for the fair:
Handshake’s Guide to Success at Virtual Career Fairs
If you’re looking for more guidance on navigating a virtual career search, we are here for you! The CPDC team is available to help you before, during, and after the fair. Don’t hesitate to email us any questions or schedule an appointment with your career consultant.
We are looking forward to seeing you virtually at the fair!
Best,CPDC

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/554.name: *CareerEco CMU Virtual Career Fair Attendee Demo
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/events/554.description:
This will be a demo of the CareerEco Virtual Career Fair platform being used for the TOC+Encompass+Converge Silicon Valley Virtual Career Fair.

The Technical Opportunities Conference + Encompass + Converge Virtual Career Fair 2020 will take place from Monday, September 14th through Wednesday, September 16th  from 1:00 pm - 9:00pm EDT.    In preparation for the event, we have connected with CareerEco (Virtual Platform for the Virtual Career Fair) to present a demo for student attendees to learn more about how to prepare and what to expect.

To register for the CareerEco Demo on September 9th from 4pm-5pm ET:
https://cmu.zoom.us/webinar/register/WN_Tw0RZNTNTHyWU33gjmh2ug
Once registered, you will receive a Zoom link for the webinar. This session will also be recorded for those who are unable to view the live demo.

To register for the Virtual Career Fair (September 14,15, and 16):
The Virtual Career Fair will be hosted on the platform, "CareerEco" please create an account using your Andrew email and register for each day of the virtual fair using the links below:

Day 1: https://www.careereco.com/Events/CMU-Sept14

Day 2: https://www.careereco.com/Events/CMU-Sept15

Day 3: https://www.careereco.com/Events/CMU-Sept16

We understand that participating in a virtual recruiting environment will be different than participating in person, but this joint virtual career fair will also present our students with new opportunities, such as:

● Uploading resumes into the virtual platform in advance to give employers more time to review your qualifications, which increases your opportunity to stand out.
● Checking the CareerEco platform ahead of time to more efficiently and effectively identify the employers that are the best fit for you, which allows you to easily identify the most important details you need to know.
● Accessing more companies than could traditionally be accommodated in-person, which means more opportunities will be available to you in a broader array of majors.
● No waiting in line, which gives you the ability to talk to more employers and provides more flexibility to easily come and go.

https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/career_fai.name: 2020 Virtual Law School Fair, Villanova University
https://cmu.joinhandshake.com/career_fai.description: Villanova University invites you to attend our 2020 Virtual Law School Fair on Tuesday, September 15, 2020, from 4:00 PM to 7:00 PM (EST). This event gives prospective law students the opportunity to explore options for furthering their education in the field of law by engaging in conversations withABA-approved law schools and LSAT and GRE test preparation companies. Admissions representatives from several top law schools will be in attendance and many will be distributing application fee waivers. Representatives will describe many aspects of their schools, discuss admissions criteria, and answer your questions. Additionally, LSAT and GRE test preparation companies will be in attendance to speak to you about their study materials, prep courses, tutoring options, and more. Unlike in-person law school fairs, there are no lines to wait in! However, you MUST sign up in advance for a time slot to speak with a law school admissions representative or LSAT/GRE test prep representative. There is no limit on how many 1-on-1 slots you can sign up for but these interactions last 10 minutes. You will also have the opportunity to sign up for 30 minute information sessions hosted by law schools and test prep companies. All of this can you do once registration opens. If you have any questions regarding the event, please contact Christina Butler, pre-law advisor: christina.butler@villanova.eduVSB B2B-Approved:  Career Exploration Track
